title: Acceleration for car slowing down over a hill

content.question: A <math alttext="1600 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1600</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> car is traveling over a hill that has a radius of curvature of <math alttext="25 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>25</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The car is slowing down as it goes over the hill. It slows down at a constant rate from a speed of <math alttext="25 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>25</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> to a speed of <math alttext="10 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> over a distance of <math alttext="50 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>50</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ending at the top of the hill. The net acceleration of the car at the top of the hill is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="4.0 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>4.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="5.3 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>5.3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="6.6 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>6.6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="9.3 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>9.3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="26 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>26</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="6.6 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>6.6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
